result.execSummary:
The defendant Adam K Boyer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Subject to good time and work release.
Consecutive to: Count 2
Must sign up at Probation today (4/18/2017)

miscConds.notes: $265.60 fine/costs to be paid to the Clerk of Court Office within 60 days or set up payment plan. Failure to pay will be tax intercept, suspension and/or civil judgment.

Must provide DNA sample and pay the $200.00 DNA surcharge to the Clerk of Court Office within 60 days or set up payment plan. Failure to pay will be tax intercept, suspension and/or civil judgment.   Defendant may request expungement of the DNA sample under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4) by petitioning the Wisconsin Department of Justice. Expungement of DNA is NOT a court process. 
For information see: http://www.doj.state.wi.us/dles/crime-labs/clb-forms.

timeConds.notes: Subject to work release. Not subject to good time.

2 CASES:  16CM111 and 16CM188:  Defendant Adam K Boyer in court, in custody.  Kenneth N. Sortedahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Brian Thomas Smestad appeared by phone means for Defendant Adam K Boyer.  JP-clerk  Qualifies. Per Atty Smestad, has resolution.  Quash Warrant.  VR compliance.  DE pleads G to Counts 1 & 2 in file 16CM111.  Ct accepts.  Ct finds DE FVI&K enters plea.  CT finds DE G and enters J on 16CM111.  16CM188 R/I for restitution and dismissed w/o prej. and w/o costs.

SENTENCE: 16CM111 - Count 1 - I/S 120 days PCJ.  Count 2 I/S 120 days PCJ.  both counts consecutive.  Subj to GT and WR.  Probation 1 year.  Count 1- 60 days cond. jail time, sub to WR and not subj to GT.  DNA sample on each count of $200/each.  Fine/Cost of $265.60 on count 1.  Sign up @ probation today.
